name: sky
content:

Add to word list
A2 [ S or U ] the area above the earth, in which clouds, the sun, etc. can be seen: a blue/cloudy/dark sky Can you see those birds high up in the sky? We looked up at/into the sky at the sound of the plane.
Dove Lee/Moment/GettyImages skies [ plural ]
the sky in a particular state or place: For weeks we had cloudless blue skies. We're off to the sunny skies of Florida.
More examplesFewer examplesWe could see hundreds of stars in the clear desert sky.The sky was a perfect blue - not a cloud in sight.The sun climbed higher in the sky.The outline of the castle on the hill was clearly defined against the evening sky.The sky was alight with hundreds of fireworks.
